item.title: Uneven paving. Paving stone sticking out, 16th September
item.description:
Whilst walking from London Zoo to Camden tube station, I fell and went flying head first into metal barriers that were dividing the road. I do not know the name of the road but I know that there was a weeping willow tree there and there was also pelican crossing there to cross the very busy road. The metal barriers, actually saved me, if it wasn't for them, I would have gone straight into the road and under a car or bus
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 64-70, Camden High Street, Chalk Farm, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Non-household waste in the communal bin area of Clifford House, mattresses, shelves, drawers ect., 16th September
item.description:
The communal bin area in my block of flats (1 Calverley Close, Clifford House, Beckenham) has been used for fly tipping for the past several months. I have attached a photo of a notice that Riverside (our estate management company) put up highlighting the problem, but that's done nothing to deter the individuals. It's now reached a point where the bin area is completely overflowing as nothing has been collected, presumably because the waste collectors won't empty it as there's so much non-household rubbish there. The smell is becoming an issue but the more pressing concern is the vermin being attracted by all the waste, namely rats and foxes. The bins haven't been emptied for at 3 weeks now so I've sent this report to bring the issue to your attention as it is now a matter of public health concern, I hope to hear back from you soon, Thanks.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 1, Calverley Close, Beckenham, London
Report on FixMyStreet
